website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, reliable fitness tracker that measures heart rate and calories burned.
pros: Great choice for basic function without the bells and whistles of other fitness trackers
Loved for its continuous, accurate heart rate monitor (chest strap included)
Beeps when you go out of your zone, a function that can be turned on and off
cons: Strap must be cleaned regularly to work properly

customer_reviews.title: I expected far better from Polar
customer_reviews.text: Many times while exercising - mainly walking outdoors - the watch will stop detecting the heart rate monitor and you have to completely stop and restart the workout. Very frustrating as it breaks your stride and then to record your workout, you have to add up multiple entries. I expected far better from Polar. It became enough of an issue that I stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hr monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have had about 7 of these. I work out 6 days a week, 2 hrs a day, so my he monitors typically last a year. I get this one every time. Easy to use, calculates calories, I have cross checked it with a manual heart rate reading and it is accurate. Friends who own this generally have had it last much longer. It does not link to a phone so if you are a fan of fit bits or any other devices, this is not your gig. I never need to worry about anything else working except this, never interferes with other fitness members.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: I liked this tracker when it worked. Sometimes I would be in the middle of my exercise class and it stopped working for some unknown reason due to the heart rate monitor getting off track. This product has some great features like the calories burned feature and it keeps the history. The downfall for me is having to wear the heart rate monitor instead of just wearing the tracker on your wrist. Sometimes the heart rate monitor slips when you’re doing an intense workout and it stops working. I don’t like that because I need to keep track of my calories burned.
customer_reviews.author: Corrin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could find a negative for this review but I simply can not. The product works so well and it's an absolute blast to be able to see the calories add up as your working out. I would not recommend this product IF you are wanting to wear it all day. The band does get quite sweaty but it is perfect for using during gym sessions/ runs! I find it is so much easier to be motivated when you are seeing the numbers climb on this counter. And knowing where your heart rate is can be really useful for someone who's not in the best health and trying to not over work it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Cormier

customer_reviews.title: FABRIC chest strap.  Very comfortable.  Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice distance runner in training for my first 1/2 marathon. I've been looking for a product to measure my heart rate (HR) during the various stages of my training. Prior to purchasing this product, I'd considered a pricier Basis B1 (to the tune of $150+). But I don't require the bells and whistles of the latter. And the Basis does not allow real-time HR monitoring - you have to come to a stop before it will register a HR. I'd been turned off by chest-strap HR monitors in the past (the neoprene or plastic chafes and is uncomfortable). But this chest strap is FABRIC! Awesome! I actually forget that I'm wearing it. Highly recommended. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: TabascoMD

customer_reviews.title: Great, basic heart rate monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a basic heart rate monitor that would count calories. This is it. Incredibly easy to program (just plug in gender, weight height). It syncs up to every machine at the gym and projects your rate heart in front of you. It counts calories very accurately which I certainly appreciate. My only complaint is that the actual heart rate belt is pretty large. It's a one size fits all belt because it's adjustable (like a bra strap). However, I'm 5'2 110 pounds and pretty tiny and it often slips down off of my rib cage even on the smallest setting. Kind of annoying - would hope Polar may make a smaller band.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice HRM
customer_reviews.text: I used this for about 6 months. I liked it while I was using it. The band that goes around your chest fits well. It's adjustable and pretty comfortable. I didn't feel like I was wearing anything extra under my clothes. Their customer service is awesome. After about a month of using the watch, the heart rate sensor stopped connecting to the watch, which obviously makes the watch pointless. After contacting them, they sent me a replacement, no questions asked. I've stopped using it now since I wasn't doing much real working out and switched over to using a fitbit. But once I get in shape and start working out beyond going for walks, I'll definitely bring this out again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M

customer_reviews.title: Great - until you need to change the battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Polar FT4 in 2012. It was great! I used it to train for my first 2 marathons and mud runs. In June 2014 the battery died in the chest HRM. I replaced it myself following the instructions. It worked fine. In November 2014 the battery in the watch itself died. I changed the battery myself as well. However, after the battery change the watch constantly loses connection with the HR monitor. I never get an accurate readout from my workouts anymore. Long and short - the Polar FT4 worked great until it needed new batteries. This is essentially a disposable product. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Yankee fan

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: I definitely feel like this Watch should do more for the costs. Like why not count steps and then also sync with heart rate monitor for workouts. Sometimes you have to fit in fitness where you can throughout your everyday. Now in order to follow my trainer and participate in activity challenges with friends I have to either A wear two watches or B swap them out when my environment changes. It’s a waste of money to have two watches...
customer_reviews.author: Chyna

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor for the value!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this heart rate monitor for over a year. I really love this monitor and have depended on it as motivation for every workout. It's really easy to set up and the strap is pretty comfortable. My only issue is the heart rate monitor stops transmitting occasionally. It usually happens during strenuous workouts for me (running, lifting) and with a little adjusting it comes back. The strap is a bit worn out at this point and the watch is starting to act up but after a year of A LOT of use, I'm not upset about it. Just time to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Torres

customer_reviews.title: Motivating!
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using this on my weight loss journey. It is a great motivational tool too. While you're dying during your exercise routine (jk) and feel like giving up you can look down and say "WOW I have burnt 350 calories! Let me keep going!". You record your weight and height (adjust these as you lose) and it provides you with your target heart rate. It will alert you with a beeping noise if you are under or go over your target heart rate. It also keeps track of how long you have been working out. This is very user friendly. The heart monitor is adjustable and not uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah H.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I hate that you have to wear a chest strap but for the most accurate this is the only way to go I love this Heart Rate Monitor. i have compared it to other equipment while using it and it has been spot on with my calorie burn and heart rate I don't swim so I haven't tried the waterproof function but I've used it in the gym for a month and it has been great My only concern is since it functions like a watch where it's always on I just wonder how long until the batteries die because that will suck unlike other calorie tracking products where you can charge it
customer_reviews.author: FLBeachmom

customer_reviews.title: NEED A DIFFERENT STRAP to transmit heart rate in the pool.  Strap is waterproof, but won't transmit through water.
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch. BUT. The contrast on the black in the LED is not dark enough to read well...particularly if you don't have your reading glasses on. My old Polar had great contrast. The other thing. If you want to swim with it, you need a different strap. You need the T31 CODED transmitter. The one that comes with the FT4 will not transmit through water. I wish I had known that prior to buying. The description is VERY misleading. Yes. you can splash it with water & even swim with it, but the strap will not transmit the heart rate to the watch if the strap is SUBMERGED. Other wise...I really like it & it was affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Merkel

customer_reviews.title: Had since 2012, No Real Problems
customer_reviews.text: bought this in 2012. Since then I decided I needed/wanted more options so I bought a Fitbit. I don't trust the Fitbit to give me an accurate read. As irritating as the chest strap may be, I think it's pretty accurate. This is an old model so it doesn't have the connectivity to an app I'm looking for now. All of this is frustrating, meaning that I still use it for workouts and keep the Fitbit for daily activities. The biggest issues relate to the batteries, but once you replace them periodically, you can pick up on the issue. I change batteries about every six months.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Does what need it to do.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this HRM as it's the second one I order. This helped me lose weight the first time around along with logging my food in on MFP. It's plain and simple as well as easy to use. Calculates the calories burned, keeps track of my heart rate and let's me know if I'm under or over my target zone. I love it and would recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Polar FT4 Watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY pleased with my Polar FT4 watch. I have tried many variations of heart rate monitors and calorie counter mechanisms that all seem to work half hazard with inconsistent results. I tested the calories burned while on a treadmill, three different elliptical brands in the gym and two different bicycles. Each time, my watch had the EXACT same amount of calories burned as the machines used at the moment. This watch is also extremely useful in bootcamps and other fitness classes where I don't have to guess at how many calories I have burned. It can be for a beginner or experienced athlete who simply wants to keep track of their own fitness progress.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best heart rate monitor watch for exercise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product after it was recommended to me by a cycle instructor and I LOVE it. It provides me with a great reading of my heart rate and calories burned while providing me with live information while I'm working out so I know if I need to kick it up or slow down to stay within the target range for my heart rate. Heart rate band is comfortable to wear and I haven't had any trouble with it as of yet and I've had the product for over a year. I wear this watch and heart rate band during cycling, hiking, hot yoga, pilates and yoga exercises
customer_reviews.author: Khart

customer_reviews.title: I thought I got a bad unit from a bad batch the first time
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Polar HRM that has failed after only a couple months of use. The transmitter will not communicate with the receiver; it shows no heart rate. I thought I got a bad unit from a bad batch the first time. The second one was purchased as a gift over a year later and the third was purchased about 6 months later. All three have the same issue. If you contact Polar you are required to fill out a claim online then PAY OUT OF POCKET for shipping to get the unit looked at!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly R

customer_reviews.title: They work great for about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through two of these now ... they work great for about 6 months, and then even with a battery change in both the watch and the transmitter, washing the strap, tightening the strap, using the special gel ... I just can't get a consistent reading :( I'd send it back to Polar, but I'm sure it would work while they tested it .. it does that, sometimes on, then off, can't find a heartbeat, recording a super low, or super high. At this point it's become more frustrating and distracting than motivating. When it worked, I really liked the feedback both during, and after exercise.
customer_reviews.author: *BlackhamBunch*

customer_reviews.title: FAILURE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December and absolutely loved it! It worked great until the beginning of February when it started occasionally losing my hear rate. So I followed the hand books troubleshooting- replaced the battery, tried cleaning the connections, tried tightening the strap all with no relief to the problem. It doesn't even read my heart rate at all now- constantly says check heart rate transmitter. After reading more of the reviews I can't tell if it is worth the hassel to send in to Polar as I have read so many bad things. Sad this was not built with the quality I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Crysta Ogrady

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it's wet AND snug!
customer_reviews.text: I almost came here soon after buying this to rate it 1 star because it kept cutting out midway through my circuit training and cycling sessions. I came to realize two things.. one, you really have to run the strap (without the transmitter snapped on) under your tap to fully saturate it two, make sure it's snug! At first, I was thinking "man, this is going to be annoying" but I quickly forgot about the snug sensation and now I never notice it. It doesn't get in the way, physically or mentally! Did those two things and voila! it hasn't cut out once and I've used it for many weeks now without a hitch!
customer_reviews.author: Maine Mama

customer_reviews.title: Very cool gadget for workouts --
customer_reviews.text: So... I like this product. Everytime I would workout, I would wonder if my gym's equipment was calibrated to show proper calories burned. I never saw consistency with the reporting on the gym's equipment, which is why I wanted this watch. It fits a little awkwardly around my chest, but I think I could have spent more time adjusting the straps for comfort. It did prove to me that my calories burned were less than what my gym equipment reported, which justified the purchase. Honestly, I would have preferred a smaller device on my wrist... but I saw this one on sale for $50, which is why I purchased it. If you can find it on sale, get it.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMariONeal

customer_reviews.title: Eventually I decided that exercise is a good idea, whether or not I have a gadget ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this years ago when I first became "serious" about fitness. I thought I needed all of these gadgets and doodads to "make me" lose weight but that's not how anything works lol. I used it for a while but the strap would interfere with my bra band and I would have to take it off (the watch band, not the bra! haha!) and it wouldn't aways record properly because of this. Eventually I decided that exercise is a good idea, whether or not I have a gadget tracking everything, and I don't use this anymore when I work out.
customer_reviews.author: Cristan

customer_reviews.title: Wrist band too short for a large person!
customer_reviews.text: This a very highly rated and popular product, and yet they don't even tell you what size person it fits. I had to return this model because, it turns out that it is a "women's" watch! How can you tell? The way I found out was to get on live chat on Polar's website and ask which model have a longer strap. Their answer is the FT4M. On Kohl's website the description says whether it it is a man's watch or a woman's watch. I didn't actually get to do anything with it other than the initial settings, which was easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Fdavet

customer_reviews.title: FREAKING LOVE THIS WATCH
customer_reviews.text: FREAKING LOVE THIS WATCH. I have never had any sort of fitness watch/step monitor/etc. type health tracker. Ever. The most I have ever done is track my calories in an app. This watch, makes me feel like I am conquering the world every time I am done with a work out. I know I push myself harder to see that calorie count go higher and higher. My first work out with this watch, I burned almost 800 calories. I just couldn't stop. Now I average about 500 calories per work out. Its so nice to see that my weight training is burning so many calories! Go Polar! I love the price! Never ha an issue ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: VSatisfied

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my heart rate monitor! Simple to use, extremely accurate and cute! The only thing I don't love is that you have to wear the chest strap to use it. I'm not sure if that's how all hrm work, but it's kind of a pain. Other reviewers are correct, you have to get the chest strap a little wet before working on to get it to work. The few times I haven't done it, it wasn't able to sense my heart rate. Overall, I love this product. It motivates me to workout harder and it's nice to see when I'm in my target heart rate zone. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Adams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Timex heart rate monitor, and a fitness friend recommended I switch to Polar when I noticed my calorie burn seemed unrealistically high. I bought this one, set up was a breeze. I was working out in less than 10 minutes after opening it up. I love how it shows your heart rate the entire time, in large enough numbers to see. You can leave the alarm on, or turn it off, but it alerts you if you are outside of your heart rate zone (which you can set yourself). It very accurately tracks calories and time. I highly recommend this product. The chest strap is comfortable and doesn't chafe at all.
customer_reviews.author: Liz T.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have had no trouble with this monitor. It works exactly as claimed. It fits my tiny wrist. It is always accurate, and keeps data from my workouts. The screen is very visible and easy to read while exercising. I bought this monitor because I wanted a way to count calories during circuit training workouts, and its great for that purpose. I've also used it bicycling, jogging, doing martial arts, and sitting around (wanted to see what my resting rate was) The sound it makes when you are in or out of your zone is a little quiet if you exercise with music or wear headphones. That could be a problem for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to set (ouch)
customer_reviews.text: It works okay I have some major issues with the side buttons , you have to press the sharp little pinpoints so hard to reset your fingers feel like they are bleeding. I thought it was just me not knowing the amount of pressure to apply but after a few months it doesn't get any better , then you just get tires of trying to reset and the pain I quit using it.It does seem to be pretty accurate heart rate wise but by the time you strap on the heart strap and try to set the watch I have lost my momentum
customer_reviews.author: L. Gerde

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 6 months and mind you I did not use it daily only 3x a week during my workout. The watch is still going but the heart rate monitor strap ran out of battery. I bought batteries but it did not help. I expected more from polar. Maybe the more expensive polar watches are better. I need a new heart monitor that will last longer
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: One of my top workout items!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Polar monitor! I purchased it on recommendation from several friends when I began exercising and tracking calories, and it has been instrumental in my weight loss journey. I've lost 20+ lb since I purchased it, and along with tracking my daily calorie intake, the monitor has been so helpful in figuring out how many calories I've burned while exercising so that I can adjust what I eat. Additionally, I like that I can easily see what my heart rate is during my workout so I can make sure that I stay within the calorie-burning zone.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Berlin

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for heart monitoring!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a polar watch for years and the last time I changed the battery, I didn't get the back sealed tight enough and some water got in the watch while I was swimming. The watch still worked, but some of the display didn't work. I used it for another year and then decided just to order a new watch. Wow! I wish I would have upgraded sooner. The heart band is so much more comfortable. No hard plastic! The watch is easy to use and motivates me to burn more calories. The watch is comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ciesielski

customer_reviews.title: Love this heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Love this heart rate monitor. It's easy to use and the displays are easy to read and follow. It's not overly complicated. It does what it says. Tracks your calories and your heat rate accurately. I've noticed some differences in my heart rate and calorie numbers between the monitor and the cardio equipment that I use. Sometimes minor differences, some times not. I decided to go with the monitor. I feel like I'm getting a more accurate count for the calories burn as well as an accurate heart rate reading. For me no more guess work.
customer_reviews.author: L. Helfert

customer_reviews.title: Cute and efficient HRM
customer_reviews.text: Love this heart rate monitor! I use it when i workout to get a better idea of calorie burn (I also have a fit bit that I use, but I feel this is more accurate when it comes to certain workouts, like yoga and Pilates, where I might not have as many "steps"). The chest strap is very comfortable and easy to clean, and the watch itself is just so cute and fits my relatively small wrist (it adjusts easily, and has a lot of little holes so that it will fit all wrist sizes). The functions are easy to figure out, and the display is easy to read. Overall I am extremely pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JC Valade

customer_reviews.title: but the chest strap is annoying. I bought this product around Nov 2013
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to keep track of calories burned while swimming. It works really well, but the chest strap is annoying. I bought this product around Nov 2013, and still haven't had to change the batteries yet. Yeah! Probably have to after I said that. It also works well for keeping track of calories while weight lifting, which I like quite a bit. I am waiting on the the new Fitbit Charge HR to come out that keeps track of heartrate without a chest strap. I will switch to that when it is available.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: my wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: I finally convinced my wife to wear a hear rate monitor as a training tool. She is pregnant and had to hear it from a magazine and her doctor first. She loves all of the different options and training tools with this monitor. Her only gripes are that the watch is not too flexible yet. I imagine it will wear in as the rubber becomes softer. The monitor also takes some time to sync and sometimes requires wetting on the sensors in order to sync. My timex works every time as long as the batteries are good. I personally will switch to Polar when my Timex is finished.
customer_reviews.author: freezer16801

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on which heart rate monitor would be best for me on my weight loss journey and I decided on this one. I have owned this product for over a year and have lost over 70 pounds! Of course this was not due in fact to the awesome quality of this HRM, but the monitor has greatly helped me to track my heart rate and calorie burn during workouts. I use this HRM 3 or 4 times a week, and it has yet to let me down! I love love love my Polar FT4 and would highly suggest it to anyone in the market for something to help you track and be accountable!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for only 3 days, but already in love. Set up is super easy (watch the YouTube video for step by step). The interface is easy to understand and read. The writing is pretty small, so may be difficult for some. Chest strap is adjustable and fits nicely. I am not a small gal, so the fact that it fits- comfortably, is saying something. The pink is really pretty and the watch fits just fine. If it doesnt fit your larger wrist, you can always just fasten it to your tank top strap as it doesnt need actual contact with your wrist in order to work (thats what the chest strap is for)
customer_reviews.author: Davis Fam

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch!
customer_reviews.text: When you first get your watch you have to enter your information (gender, weight, etc) & once you start using the watch it keeps logs of your workouts. If you have to pause for any reason during your workout the watch will pause and resume when you press the button. This watch keeps me motivated because I am concerned about calories burned & it even beeps when I'm in zone, etc. I noticed some people complained in the reviews that the watch doesn't turn off. The reason why is because it is like a regular watch that keeps track of the time of day so you can wear it even when you're not working out.
customer_reviews.author: Eb

customer_reviews.title: This is the best heart monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is the best heart monitor. I have had to replace the battery in the watch and I do use this with conductor jelly. I have had no problem at all and am amazed how many extra calories the machines say I'm burning, as opposed to what the monitor says. This means I was giving myself extra calories burned than what I should have been for quite a long time! My heart rate also shows up on the machine so I don't have to hold the metal heart detector panels.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Rohrbacker

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I love this and use it for my cardio, supersets, and lifting! Easy to use, activate, set up, and small enough to throw in my purse. Im super petite so the band is a little big so I need to knot it one time but it works excellent otherwise and doesn't interfere with function of reading heart rate. Band has a lot of knotches for bigger wrist sizes to small size like mine. Absolutely can't do without my watch and seems to be very accurate. The website when you register has many tutorials to walk you through if you're not so tech savvy too which was great!
customer_reviews.author: Boo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the first HRM i've owned and it has performed perfectly, giving me basic information on High and Average Heart Rate as well as how long in the zone and approximate calories burned. It allows me to compare workouts and adjust my intensity as I go with the HR displayed continuously. The only thing I wish it would do that it doesn't is display the time along with the HR on the face while you're exercising. It tracks the time and displays it at the end, but would like to see the timer and the HR as I go. But, overall, a very good product that I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Onalee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I love my HRM! It works well! I sometimes put some Vaseline on the band when I run though, I'm a larger busted girl, so it occasionally digs into the underline of my breast, but that usually only happens after 6-7 miles of running. Band fits well right under your sports bra, easily tells time, heart rate, you can turn on the sound so it beeps when you are not within your target HR. I would recommend this product to all of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Adams

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a simple, no bells and whistles, heart rate monitor. Polar use to make a decent one in the $50 price range. Now they keep adding more and more functions that I personally never use. I just want to instantly see my HR when working out! I find all the button pushing aggravating and the Heart Rate doesn't pick up until I am well into my cardio workout. I even try to wet the chest band to prime it first. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DDinAZ

customer_reviews.title: and it's definitely been useful for me doing strength training and HIIT
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a week, and it's definitely been useful for me doing strength training and HIIT. When I use it on the treadmill, the heart rate monitor also sends the information to the display on the machine (although sometimes I find that I get a different reading on the machine than on the watch-- watch seems to be more accurate). I do find the watch slightly uncomfortable sometimes when I'm doing push-ups or other similar exercises, so sometimes I'll take it off and keep it next to me for those workouts. The HRM fits great and is easily adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: honeytangerine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I got this in January for a birthday present and it worked really well for the first month, but the past 30 days, it's been losing the heart monitor signal at random during workouts, and often I spend more time just trying to get the thing working than working out. I've tightened it, re-wet it several times in these situations. Very frustrating, and I've been caring for it as the instructions dictate. Now the return window has closed and I'm not sure what to do. Very disappointed with this product. It doesn't work at all now. My husband had a Garmin hr monitor. It worked like a charm for years.
customer_reviews.author: Kletterin

customer_reviews.title: Recommended - not just for athletes
customer_reviews.text: Update.... A year later and the watch stopped working. Not sure if this is typical. I bought this months ago to jumpstart my workout schedule and it's been very useful. I'm no athlete, but I wanted to start running and was curious about my overall health. If you work out too hard, it can be bad for you. Alternatively, you don't want to be working out too lightly. I use this watch to monitor the intensity of my workouts. It beeps when my heartrate is "out of zone". You also don't feel the heart rate strap while you're working out - so it's def a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy L.

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in the pink/purple color. I think it's super cute and serves its purpose. I like that there are several different viewing options (1. HR, 2. Calories burned, 3. Workout time, 4. HR range). When I get tired of looking at one of views, I can quickly and easily change to the next. The backlight also helps when it's dark. I feel like I work out harder than I used to since I know exactly how many calories I'm burning. My one complaint is that the watch is a little bit uncomfortable, but it could be that my wrist is really bony. Other than that, the chest strap is comfortable and I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad
customer_reviews.text: The Bad: I had to replace both batteries within the first month. It doesn't work for my dynamic yoga that I do. Once I bend over it can't seem to give me appropriate readings, but if I stand upright again, it works fine. A great watch for those who run or do some other cardio, but if you are doing a downward dog or anything that requires you to bend you might experience problems. I like it. I just wished it worked better for me, and that I didn't have to spend $15 more dollars for new batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool for Exercise and Health
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tool for anyone who wants to exercise and keep track of their heart rate and calorie burn. A must for anyone who needs to keep on top of their heart health. Mine is pink but it also comes in a range of other colors. I bought this one here but I actually went to the company's website and they're twice the price there. This is a good deal and the seller is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C

customer_reviews.title: I love my Polar FT4
customer_reviews.text: I love my Polar FT4! Make sure you follow the directions and get the band wet before use, and then clean it and dry it after use. Also make sure you unplug the battery from the band after use. I love being able to know how many calories I burned as well as where my heart rate is, so I know when to step it up or when to take a break. It's really helped me get the most out of my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Love using this for my workouts. I feel like it keeps me on track and helps me to work out harder since I can see how many calories I have burned and what my heart rate is. I think it was definitely worth the buy! It's very comfortable to wear and the chest strap is also comfortable and doesn't slide around under my shirt. I love that it keeps track of my past workout times and calories burned so I can see what I need to improve on and how to tweak my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: S&K Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a previous Polar FT7 and my current Fitbit Charge HR. I always come back to the Polar HR for my workouts because the Fitbit is useless the second I start to sweat. I love this one, and got it in a Black Friday sale. It gives me exactly what I need, which is my calories burned per workout. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of this monitor! It is super easy to figure out. I purchased this because I wanted to see how on track the machines at my gym were...and, it is a good thing I did! One added bonus that I didn't know until after I purchased: the band also wirelessly connects to the machines at my gym! And, those readings match the watch. I have only had one issue where the band and watch were not "connecting" to each other, but I washed the band and everything was fine! I have had this for about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: SF513

customer_reviews.title: P{olar FT4 heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is exactly what I wanted, easy to use, easy to read, accurate and doesn't get interference from the treadmill. I had another brand that kept shutting off but this one has not shut off once in 2 months. I ordered the pink one thinking maybe it would be a little smaller and it is the right size for my wrist. I would highly recommend this monitor to anyone. Great product and great value if what you are looking for is a basic heart monitor.
customer_reviews.author: queensheba

customer_reviews.title: I love this heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I love this heart rate monitor! I was using this thing faithfully during all of my workouts up until the battery went dead and I have yet to replace it lol.This thing definitely kept me motivated, I really love that you can track your weight on here and get an accurate measure of the calories you're burning. I'd definitively be willing to purchase this again since I lost the back to my watch. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Bria1993

customer_reviews.title: So Great For My Zumba Classes
customer_reviews.text: I use this at least 5 days a week and it's amazing! I am a Zumba instructor and wear this to get a calorie count for my classes. It works great. The watch is a fun pink color that goes with all my outfits and I completely forget about the band around my waist when i'm teaching. My classes love to know about how many calories we burned (everyone will be a little different. I use this to give them a general range) I've had this for over a year and still haven't had to replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: KaiNai02

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for tracking activity and calories
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the market for something to track my activities and calories accurately for a while. I found that some way overshot how many calories I was burning, and some didn't count at all. This device has been accurate and even pushes me harder when I exercise because I can see the real numbers (heart rate, calories, time, etc.). I use this in conjunction with the My Fitness Pal to make me accountable for what goes in and what I burn out. I am already seeing phenomenal results! I would highly recommend as part of your fitness regimine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND 100%
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. it comes with a band that you wear under and around your chest/breast which reads your heart rhythm. Its easy to use and easy to set up. There is a start button which you press when you start your workout, a pause button if you want to continue later or for a few minutes, and a stop button which shows you the summary of your workout. It tells you how long you worked out for, your average heart rate, how many calories you burned and it also saves all your previous workouts with dates and duration.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: I have loved using this monitor both for my distance runs as ...
customer_reviews.text: I have loved using this monitor both for my distance runs as well as during workouts wherein it would otherwise be very difficult to estimate calories burned, ie resistance and/or interval training. The display is nothing fancy but certainly not bad. I think the only thing I could say may be a potential drawback is that the device is not quite as intuitive as I had hoped. It has taken me some time to master the start, pause and stop functions and the guest room
customer_reviews.author: labecker88

customer_reviews.title: Polar FT4 over the Fitbit ANY DAY!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Polar FT4!! I've wanted it for a few years but never purchased until now because of the extremely reasonable price. It works great and is super easy as well as accurate. It pushes you by beeping when you're below you're lowest HR (you set your range of heart rate for your workouts) and warns you by beeping if your HR gets too high! I workout every single day for over an hour and this is my new favorite gadget! 10/10 would recommend to anyone who's active. Also serves as a cute athletic watch. I sold my Fitbit for this and I don't regret it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Weight Loss Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this polar watch and hr band! The band is comfortable, and the watch is easy to set up and easy to use. I love that I can finally have an accurate count on the calories I burn during a workout. It allows me to make better food choices since I now have a set budget of intake and burn. The only complaints I have, are that this model is not able to sync up with the website, or the iPhone app. I was pretty disappointed in that. I use the "loseit" weight loss app in conjunction with my hr monitor, so it works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: CourtD

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fitness watch.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is perfect for tracking your heart rate during your workouts. I enjoy the many features it has and the fact that it has unnecessary bells and whistles. Being able to monitor my heart rate as well as track calories burned and average heart rate during my workout has allowed me to approach my fitness more strategically. I have used this in the pool and in extreme weather without any failure. I'm so glad I bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: ana quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Great heart rate monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a heart rate monitor that wouldn't slip around from sweat and would accurately keep my heart rate. I needed it for hard core circuits so that I could keep track of calories burned. The watch syncs up to the waist band quickly. I followed the instructions that came with the band to get it a little wet on the sensors. I love the pause feature on the watch. The video on Amazon page was very helpful. I really love that the watch makes noises on calories burned and out of target range (of course they can be turned off).
customer_reviews.author: S Carsey

customer_reviews.title: New models new strap doesnt pick up as well...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second polar watch I've owned. The first one worked really well and lasted FOREVER! Now since then they have changed the design of the heart rate strap so now its not picking up my heart rate as well as the older model used to. At least that's why I think it doesn't work as well. I have to keep syncing it back to the watch throughout my workout. So in summary the older model worked awesomely and this model not so much. I still use it because it still works well enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: The D's

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I discovered the Polar FT4. After doing plenty of research on heart monitors I puchased my polar in August 2014. I cannot workout without it. If I forget it at home I feel like my workout isn't the same. The product is accurate and I've learned the fitness equipment doesn't always give the most accurate info. The monitor band is comfortable, can be cleaned with warm soapy water and is adjustable. Maybe later this year I may treat myself to an upgrade! Oh of course the price was right!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Easy and Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest and most efficient heart rate monitor I have ever owned. I was so devastated to lose my Polar H7 - and all the re-orders were defective - so I purchased this. I dreaded setting up zones, time, date - but it was a total cinch! I didn't even need the instruction book - it was just completely obvious on how to set it up. Very easy to use and it is reliable - unlike the H7. So if you like to see how your workouts are going and you need a unit you can count on - order this!
customer_reviews.author: DiveDeeper

customer_reviews.title: I might be one of the few people on the planet who refuses to get a smart phone and most of the more modern HR monitors ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I might be one of the few people on the planet who refuses to get a smart phone and most of the more modern HR monitors require them to up link to your smart phone. With this I can track my heart rate and see aproximately how many calories I burned without the need of a smart phone. My only gripe is that I got it in pink but out of all the colors it had the lowest cost. This didn't keep me from giving it 5 stars though.
customer_reviews.author: Jules H.

customer_reviews.title: wanted quality and uncomplicated
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing several brands and talking with others who have a Polar FT4, I went with it. It was delivered in rapid time and I began using it that day, it was easy to figure the settings out. For anyone wanting an uncomplicated monitor, this fits the bill. It shows me my me my HR range, average, calories burned and more that I don't use as frequently. It's sturdy, is well made and I am very happy with my purchase. I gave it five stars because I was able to use gift cards and paid a fraction of the normal cost, and it meets all of my requirements.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! My only issue is that it's a little difficult to figure out how to use even with the instructions. But once you figure out which buttons do what it's fine. I just wanted something to track my calories burned and avg heart rate during my workout. This product does both things very well. The strap isn't too uncomfortable either, but it is a bit shorter than I expected it would be. If you're a bigger person you may want to check the specs and measure your chest to be sure it'll fit.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it already!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for about three weeks so far, but I love it! I can't believe I didn't get it sooner. I can't say for longevity, but as far as ease of use and helpfulness throughout a workout it's great! I have the strap as tight as it can go, which is probably about 29-30", any smaller and it might not work properly. If I make it any tighter it will sit on the sensor and that's not supposed to be bent so probably not a good idea. I was afraid of it stretching too much but after washing it seems to bounce right back. No problems or regrets so far!
customer_reviews.author: Roxy_LL

customer_reviews.title: I liked how easy it is to use
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy it is to use. Unfortunately, my chest band failed in the first two months of owning it. Apparently that's a common issue with these. I have yet to buy a new one, so the watch is kind of useless. It was great while I had it and while it worked. I will probably upgrade to something a little bit more self-sustaining that doesn't require a chest band to monitor my vitals and stuff all the time when I wear it.
customer_reviews.author: ASweitzer

customer_reviews.title: Good first monitor
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Works great so far. Used it walking around the lake and learned that I need to move faster than I thought to keep my heart in the 70-80% aerobic zone. Good to know. I also learned that I generally tend to move in the fat burning zones 50-70%. Will be interested to use while do other exercises like abs, pilates, kickboxing, etc. It took me a minute to learn how to set it up and take care of it. Got the best help from other amazon reviewers, the online manual, and youtube videos.
customer_reviews.author: Vimy

customer_reviews.title: unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job ....while it lasSt. This is my second polar of the same type and model in as many years. This time it's not even 5 months and the transmitter is not transmitting.There are no authorized service centers near me and its unreasonable to have to pay for shipping and upwards of 20 bucks for a simple battery change! So I'm changing it on my own but it's still not working. I just ordered a fitbit. I'm hoping for more longevity and better service.
customer_reviews.author: Teatiiime

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Bit!!
customer_reviews.text: OMGosh!! My Elliptical machine with the heart rate monitor on the handle bars would never read 140 or I felt like I was killing myself trying to get there.... now when i wear my Polar Heart Rate Monitor, I get to my 140s and my Elliptical machine telling me my heart rate is at 220... (Ya, right! You would be seeing the first running corpse on UTube...) so I am soooooooo pleased with this purchase, I just wish I had done it a lot sooner!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Spillderbrains

customer_reviews.title: Okay not horrible but not great either. Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Thiso ne is used about 2-3 times a week and at times it has bipolar like episodes, not sure if it is the chest strap or watch itself. Can have erratic readings where one of the other older Polar's is solid. The watch goes through a battery about every 9-10 months. Chest transmitter a battery each year. The elastic chest strap is cheap so have spares if you use this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: M. F.

customer_reviews.title: Technology keeps me motivated
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this watch. I've used it 3 times at the gym but also wear the watch alone all day. It's comfortable and accurate. The chest strap is soft. I don't even notice I have it on. I like that I can look back at my training files and see the calorie burn increasing. I found that the totals match the machines at the gym, but if I'm lifting weights I still have that continuous accurate total. I'm excited to have this watch! The price is very reasonable for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Love it- helped me kick my workouts up a notch!
customer_reviews.text: After I began attending spinning classes at my gym I got the bug to get a heart rate monitor. I took a shot on this one (my first) because of the glowing reviews and I'm so glad I did. I love this heart rate monitor! It tells me exactly what I need to know: length of workout, heart rate, and calories burned. It's amazing how much seeing the number of calories burned while working out motivates me to increase the intensity of my workout. I also like that it's waterproof because I poor swear while I spin and I wear it during water aerobics. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: makes it easy to see how many calories I've burned in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm kinda new to the work out world, but this little gizmo, despite being ridiculously complicated... makes it easy to see how many calories I've burned in my time at the gym. I'm sure I'll figure out which buttons to push eventually, just make sure you keep the directions. I tossed mine before I understood it and now I'm up a creek on that front. Oh well, I can usually make it eventually do what I'm asking it to do. It's kind of a cool concept, just over-engineered to the hilt.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Shenk

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of different workouts so I wanted to know which activities were burning the most calories so I ordered this product. The chest strap took a few weeks to get used to (at first I felt like it was digging into my chest halfway through class). I love being able to see my heart rate throughout class so I know if I need to step up my game or not. I was super surprised to know I was burning more calories in fitness dance than insanity and I never would have known if it wasn't for this product. Highly recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly McKinney

customer_reviews.title: This provides me true motivation to work harder to continue seeing results.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I was happy to see the difference that this displays versus the treadmill that I have depended on for years! This really takes into account how hard YOU are working, not just an assumption by your treadmill. I have found that the more fit I am, the less calories I burn in the same workout. (I know...common sense right? BUT you need to see it for yourself!!) This provides me true motivation to work harder to continue seeing results.
customer_reviews.author: darren mcquoid

customer_reviews.title: great watch for spin class
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new watch, and the heart rate monitor, I like it more than my old model of same brand as I do not have to wet the strap for it to pick up my heart rate. It really is easy to operate. and I have really enjoyed having this too help me keep track of my calories burned and how long I stay in zone of my heart rate, and i watch to see how fast my heart rate is all during my exercise as to where i know to push myself harder or slow down a bit.
customer_reviews.author: glorygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great if it wouldn't stop breaking!
customer_reviews.text: I love this when it works but in less than 6 months it stopped and customer service sent out a new monitor, not the watch. Worked great again and no problems until this week, stopped working again! I got this heart rate monitor in May 2014 so it didn't even last 2 years. And customer service said they'd only replace it once so now I'm stuck buying a new Polar FT4 or finding something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Deenie

customer_reviews.title: Great "beginner" watch for athletes
customer_reviews.text: I got the Polar FT4 instead of the more expensive high-tech Polar watches because I have never had a heart rate monitor before. It is a great watch that doesn't bother me too much while I run or lift. I do occasionally have to loosen it if I'm doing yoga (since the poses may call for wrist movement and you don't want a watch clamped to your wrist). It is easy to use and simple to read since it tells you the basics. Like I said, it's a great watch for those who have never used one before, but for experience health/gym geeks, I would upgrade to the Polar watches that show your fat burn % and other things.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Fry

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to track my heart rate zones during interval training. I anxiously waited for it to arrive! I opened the package and read the directions which said hold any button for a few seconds and it will turn on. So.....I tried every button possible, every way possible and it wouldn't turn on :( I had to pack up my baby and make a trip to UPS to return it. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great. I've been trying to get in shape lately ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I've been trying to get in shape lately by doing DDP yoga. It recommends using the heart monitor to make sure you're engaging your muscles correctly. It's great because I know when I'm giving enough and it tells me when I'm giving too much and need to settle my heart rate a little. As for the heart rate strap, I'm plus size 2x and the monitor piece fits comfortably around my chest without any pinching or binding.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeFriends

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I can not tell you how much this watch has motivated me! Just knowing your progress makes you want to workout even harder. I have never used a workout watch before, and did lots of reaserch on this one. The price was a very good deal too. I got the pink one. I wet the belt prior to putting it on, and have not had ANY issiues with heart rate detection. Also use this watch at work. I work in the medical field, so its perfect for respirations.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with pacemaker
customer_reviews.text: The 3-star rating on this product is not really fair because it is incompatible with my pacemaker. A full rating could not be established because of this interaction and the inability to use the advanced functions on hr Polar FT4. Out of the box, the watch was very easy to set-up and the connection to monitor heart rhythm was made with little difficulty. Unfortunately, the pulsing mechanism conflicted with the pacemaker almost immediately and thus the watch had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Analytical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have already said everything about this wonderful HR monitor. Now that I have been using it awhile, I don't know how I got along without it! I love how I can tell instantly where my heart rate is at during any given workout. This device has helped me tell which workouts I need to do more of and which workouts are no longer challenging. I also love how it syncs with the machines at the gym! Great affordable gadget for anyone who is dedicated to improving themselves through exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Makes me want to keep going
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I had no idea how many calories I was burning prior to wearing this HRM. I love that it keeps track of my old data so I can see which work outs are most effective for me. I also love that I during a workout I can switch from heart rate to calories burned very easily. I find myself setting a calorie burn goal for myself instead of just saying ok lets work out for 30 minutes today. If I haven't reached my goal I keep going! It's great motivation!
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with heart Conditions or Closely Monitor their Health
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help monitor my heart rate for my exercise. I especially wanted it for the concern of my heart condition. Thanks to this, I could exercise with a lot more reassurance. Worked pretty great in the beginning, but unfortunately the band stopped working after a while. Fortunately, Amazon and the company were great about replacing it. Now I think the battery may have died, but I think that I should be able to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: I was really happy with this for about a month or two
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this for about a month or two, but after that, any time I'm doing cardio the watch will tell me to "check my heart rate" and will stop counting my calories - and I won't even be doing anything super intense (just like, a warm-up jog) and I'll feel fine - I've even used a gel for the electrode, and made sure it's positioned correctly, but no dice. If Polar could fix this issue, it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing :(
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with this watch! Only lasted me 4 workouts! When it did work, it worked great. But now, nothing. Troubleshooted and did EVERYTHING manual and Polar website instructed me to do and STILL doesn't work. Cleaned, moistened, adjusted and REadjusted strap for tighter fit and still will not get any kind of reading. Have tried it with and without any other devices (i.e., MP3 player on phone) that may interfere with frequency and it just does nothing. All it does is tell the time. :( Wish I could return it without any hassle. Really had hoped this investment on this watch was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: tigerlily512

customer_reviews.title: Such a motivator!
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulties motivating myself to work out. I read about calories in and calories out and how a deficit can help you lose weight. The heart rate monitor calculates how many calories you expend so much more accurately than the gym machines. Looking at the numbers add up is so motivating! Also, monitoring my heart rate lets me ensure that I am in my zone. That way, I don't just stop because I think or feel like I'm tired. It helps push me to work out harder to beat my previous records. I would highly, highly recommend this heart rate monitor. I just cannot enjoy a work out without it!
customer_reviews.author: dc lady

customer_reviews.title: Low battery false alarm
customer_reviews.text: When I first powered on the watch and entered my settings, the low battery icon appeared. However, it disappeared the next day. Hoping it was just a false alarm. Used the monitor for the first time tonight while teaching my Kickboxing class, and it worked very well. I have used Polar in the past and always been happy with the product...until the battery inevitably dies...
customer_reviews.author: JGK87

customer_reviews.title: Not good for hiit and stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: It takes a minute to catch up when doing hiit exercises. Somedays it wouldn't work at all, it would read my heart rate at 210!! It stopped working after a year, even after changing the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this item is no longer eligible to return. I've only been using it for two months. The first few times I used it were great, but within a week I had to replace the battery in the watch and in the heart rate sensor. For the last month the product works off and on. It constantly loses my heart rate for 30 seconds to a minute before it picks back up again, and freezes at a certain heart rate for that span of time or longer, making it unusable. Wouldn't recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed it and have had no issues
customer_reviews.text: I use this when i work out. I was more intrested on getting an acurate heartrate as apposed to steps. I personally dont see the point in a fit bit, so after research I decided on this. I have enjoyed it and have had no issues. I do not leave the monotor attached to the strap when i am not using it and if you follow the instructions the backs come off to replace battieries when its time.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Lammi

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra and get a new model or fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this old model!! Worked fine for a few weeks then I could not get it to read the heart rate transmitter. I troubleshooted and ended up ordering $10 worth of batteries and still am having the problem. I can no longer send it back or else I would. Just wasted $50 on this piece of crap! Should have bought a fitbit like I was originally going to do.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: working on it
customer_reviews.text: When I read reviews about this product the only complaint I heard was about the alarm. I have no problem hearing it even in a class at the gym with loud music the instructor speaking. This is such an improvement over my old polar heart rate monitor I am thrilled with the updates. For one thing you can change the battery in the strap. I have a record of my workouts on the watch. Easy to read the time and I am still finding more. Yes buy this monitor if your goal is to improve your fitness level!
customer_reviews.author: Summer20

product_meta.title: POLAR FT4 Heart Rate Monitor
product_meta.description:
Men's POLAR® FT4 HRM :: Reach goals quicker and easier with your Polar® FT4 Heart Rate Monitor. Track heart rate in target zones, personal improvements, calories, and a whole lot more. Graphically displays your target zone for easier viewing. Dual time zone, 8 languages, comfy heart rate strap.

Your VIP savings apply! Monitor prices are too low for additional discounts to be combined.
feature_bullets: Measures only heart rate and not foot steps
Provides continuous, accurate heart rate to keep your fitness training simple
Smart Calorie feature uses your personal data to provide accurate calories burned
Includes heart rate chest strap made of soft fabric material that adapts to your body shape; Requires and includes chest strap for accurate heart rate
User replaceable battery and water resistant (30m)
Connects with compatible gym equipment using GymLink
